bug.author: ryandawsonuk
bug.summary: installs from releases such as 0.6 of kfctl are broken
bug.description:
Thrift have moved from git.apache.org to github - <denchmark-link:https://github.com/hashicorp/terraform/issues/22664#issuecomment-527142529>hashicorp/terraform#22664 (comment)</denchmark-link>
This is fixed in master - <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/issues/4051>#4051</denchmark-link>
But tagged versions also reference the old thrift git

comments.comment: Issue-Label Bot is automatically applying the label kind/bug to this issue, with a confidence of 0.97. Please mark this comment with 👍 or 👎 to give our bot feedback! Links: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/marketplace/issue-label-bot>app homepage</denchmark-link> , <denchmark-link:https://mlbot.net/data/kubeflow/kubeflow>dashboard</denchmark-link> and <denchmark-link:https://github.com/hamelsmu/MLapp>code</denchmark-link> for this bot.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/ryandawsonuk>@ryandawsonuk</denchmark-link> broken in what way? I thought that git.apache.org was a source needed during the build of kfctl. Is it used elsewhere inside a Kubeflow installation?

Oh true what I was trying to do was build kfctl. But there's no need to do that for old releases as it can be obtained at <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/releases/>https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/releases/</denchmark-link> Thanks
